message.content: This question requires knowledge about squid locomotion. Squids move through the water by forcefully expelling water out of their mantles, which propels them forward. As a result, water is displaced directly behind the squid. Option (A) is incorrect because water is not pushed in front of the squid during locomotion. Option (B) is unrelated to squid locomotion and is a reference to a band. Option (C) is incorrect because the Great Lakes are not relevant to squid locomotion.

Option (B) is a reference to a song and not related to the squid's method of locomotion. Option (C) is unrelated to the question and refers to a different body of water.
